description: Gold standard dataset for SNP/indel variants - curated with 2024 FDA approvals

entries.notes: FDA-approved: dabrafenib+trametinib, vemurafenib+cobimetinib, encorafenib+binimetinib
references: Long GV et al. N Engl J Med 2014

entries.notes: FDA-approved: dabrafenib+trametinib for BRAF V600E NSCLC (2017)
references: Planchard D et al. Lancet Oncol 2016

entries.notes: FDA-approved: dabrafenib+trametinib for BRAF V600E ATC (2018)
references: Subbiah V et al. J Clin Oncol 2018

entries.notes: CORRECTED FROM TIER II. FDA-approved: encorafenib+cetuximab for BRAF V600E mCRC (2020). Even though later-line, BRAF V600E IS the biomarker indication for this therapy.
references: Kopetz S et al. N Engl J Med 2019 (BEACON trial)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: same BRAF inhibitors as V600E, included in label
references: FDA label includes V600E and V600K

entries.notes: Non-V600 BRAF mutation. Not FDA-approved, variable response to BRAF inhibitors, limited data
references: Dahlman KB et al. Cancer Discov 2012
Yao Z et al. Cancer Cell 2017

entries.notes: FDA-approved: osimertinib (preferred), erlotinib, gefitinib, afatinib
references: Soria JC et al. N Engl J Med 2018 (FLAURA)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: osimertinib for T790M+ NSCLC after progression on 1st/2nd-gen TKI. T790M IS the indication for osimertinib.
references: Mok TS et al. N Engl J Med 2017 (AURA3)

entries.notes: Resistance marker to osimertinib. Guides treatment selection (may use 1st-gen TKIs if in trans with T790M). No FDA-approved C797S-specific therapy.
references: Thress KS et al. Nat Med 2015

entries.notes: FDA-approved: afatinib for uncommon EGFR mutations including G719X (2018 label expansion)
references: Yang JC et al. Lancet Oncol 2015

entries.notes: FDA-approved: sotorasib (2021), adagrasib (2022)
references: Skoulidis F et al. N Engl J Med 2021

entries.notes: FDA-approved: adagrasib+cetuximab for KRAS G12C mCRC (2024)
references: Yaeger R et al. N Engl J Med 2023 (KRYSTAL-1)

entries.notes: CORRECTED FROM TIER I. Resistance marker: predicts resistance to anti-EGFR therapy (cetuximab, panitumumab). Guideline-mandated testing. By strict AMP/ASCO/CAP, exclusionary biomarkers without FDA-approved targeted therapy are Tier II, not Tier I.
references: Allegra CJ et al. J Clin Oncol 2009
NCCN Guidelines - required testing before anti-EGFR

entries.notes: No FDA-approved targeted therapy. KRAS G12D inhibitors in early trials only.
references: Hallin J et al. Cancer Discov 2022 (preclinical)

entries.notes: CORRECTED FROM TIER I. Resistance marker: predicts resistance to anti-EGFR therapy. Same reasoning as G12D - guideline-mandated but exclusionary only, no FDA-approved targeted therapy FOR KRAS.
references: De Roock W et al. JAMA 2010

entries.notes: Resistance marker: predicts resistance to anti-EGFR therapy. Required testing per NCCN. Same tier as KRAS mutations in CRC.
references: Douillard JY et al. N Engl J Med 2013

entries.notes: CORRECTED FROM TIER II. No FDA-approved NRAS-targeted therapy. MEK inhibitors (binimetinib) show activity in NEMO trial but NOT FDA-approved as monotherapy for NRAS-mutant melanoma. Investigational only.
references: Dummer R et al. Lancet Oncol 2017 (NEMO)
No FDA approval for NRAS-targeted therapy in melanoma

entries.notes: CORRECTED FROM TIER II. No FDA-approved therapy. Limited clinical data compared to Q61 mutations. Investigational only.
FDA-approved: alpelisib + fulvestrant for PIK3CA-mutated HR+/HER2- breast cancer (2019). PIK3CA mutation IS the companion diagnostic.
references: André F et al. N Engl J Med 2019 (SOLAR-1)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: alpelisib label includes E545K as actionable PIK3CA mutation
references: André F et al. N Engl J Med 2019

entries.notes: FDA-approved: alpelisib label includes E542K as actionable PIK3CA mutation
references: André F et al. N Engl J Med 2019

entries.notes: No FDA-approved PI3K inhibitor in CRC. Alpelisib approved only in breast cancer.
references: Rodon J et al. Nat Rev Clin Oncol 2013

entries.notes: FDA-approved: ivosidenib for IDH1-mutated AML (2018)
references: DiNardo CD et al. N Engl J Med 2018

entries.notes: FDA-approved: ivosidenib for IDH1-mutated cholangiocarcinoma (2021)
references: Abou-Alfa GK et al. Lancet Oncol 2020 (ClarIDHy)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: enasidenib for IDH2-mutated AML (2017)
FDA-approved: avapritinib for advanced SM with D816V (2021), midostaurin (2017)
references: DeAngelo DJ et al. N Engl J Med 2021 (PATHFINDER)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: avapritinib label covers D816 mutations broadly
FDA-approved: imatinib for KIT-mutated GIST. Exon 9 mutations (including V560D) are imatinib-sensitive, first-line therapy.
references: Demetri GD et al. N Engl J Med 2002

entries.notes: Imatinib-resistant. Avapritinib shows activity but FDA-approved for PDGFRA D842V GIST, not specifically for KIT D816V in GIST. Very rare in GIST (<1%).
references: Heinrich MC et al. J Clin Oncol 2008
Avapritinib shows activity in D816V GIST

entries.notes: Resistance marker: confers resistance to aromatase inhibitors. FDA-approved: elacestrant for ESR1-mutated ER+ breast cancer (2023)
references: Bidard FC et al. J Clin Oncol 2022 (EMERALD)

entries.notes: Resistance marker: confers AI resistance. Elacestrant FDA-approved for ESR1-mutated disease.
references: Chandarlapaty S et al. JAMA Oncol 2016

entries.notes: Prognostic but not predictive. No FDA-approved TP53-targeted therapy. Poor prognosis marker.
references: Olivier M et al. Hum Mutat 2010

entries.notes: Prognostic but not predictive. No FDA-approved TP53-targeted therapy.
Diagnostic/prognostic for CRC but not predictive for therapy selection.
VHL loss is diagnostic for ccRCC but VHL mutation status does not predict response to approved therapies (TKIs, IO). Not actionable.
references: Choueiri TK et al. Eur Urol 2021

entries.notes: FDA-approved: erdafitinib for FGFR3-mutated urothelial carcinoma (2019)
references: Loriot Y et al. N Engl J Med 2019

entries.notes: FGFR2 fusions/rearrangements have FDA-approved therapies (pemigatinib, infigratinib, futibatinib). N549K is a point mutation - less clear if it falls under FDA approval language which emphasizes fusions. Tier II for point mutations unless evidence shows equivalence to fusions.
references: Abou-Alfa GK et al. Lancet Oncol 2020 (FIGHT-202)

entries.notes: MET exon 14 skipping mutations have FDA-approved therapies (capmatinib, tepotinib). D1228N can cause exon 14 skipping. If confirmed to cause skipping, may be Tier I. As point mutation alone without confirmed functional effect, Tier II.
references: Recondo G et al. Cancer Discov 2020

entries.notes: FDA-approved: selpercatinib, pralsetinib for RET-mutated MTC
references: Wirth LJ et al. N Engl J Med 2020

entries.notes: FDA-approved: olaparib, rucaparib, niraparib for BRCA-mutated ovarian cancer
references: Moore K et al. N Engl J Med 2018 (SOLO1)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: olaparib, talazoparib for germline BRCA-mutated HER2- breast cancer. C61G is a known pathogenic BRCA1 variant.
references: Robson M et al. N Engl J Med 2017 (OlympiAD)

entries.notes: FDA-approved: avapritinib for PDGFRA D842V GIST (2020). Imatinib-resistant.
references: Heinrich MC et al. Lancet Oncol 2020 (NAVIGATOR)

entries.notes: Ultramutated phenotype, favorable prognosis. May predict immunotherapy response. Not FDA-approved indication but clinical utility.
references: Church DN et al. J Clin Oncol 2015

entries.notes: Prognostic only. Associated with worse outcomes, metastatic pattern. No targeted therapy.
references: Iacobuzio-Donahue CA et al. J Clin Invest 2009

entries.notes: Prognostic/diagnostic. Associated with CDK4/6 inhibitor sensitivity in some contexts but not FDA-approved indication in melanoma.
references: Genomic classification of cutaneous melanoma. Cell 2015

entries.notes: Potential synthetic lethality with ATR/PARP inhibitors. Phase 2 data only, not FDA-approved.
references: Bitler BG et al. Nat Med 2015
